00037 // Core structs

00039 /**
00040     Coordinates for specifying a rectangular region.
00041     @ingroup    datatypes
00042     @see        t_pt
00043     @see        t_size      */
00044 typedef struct _rect
00045 {
00046     double x;               ///< The horizontal origin
00047     double y;               ///< The vertical origin
00048     double width;           ///< The width
00049     double height;          ///< The height
00050 } t_rect;
00051 
00052 
00053 /**
00054     Coordinates for specifying a point.
00055     @ingroup    datatypes
00056     @see        t_rect
00057     @see        t_size      */
00058 typedef struct _pt
00059 {
00060     double x;               ///< The horizontal coordinate
00061     double y;               ///< The vertical coordinate
00062 } t_pt;
00063 
00064 
00065 /**
00066     Coordinates for specifying the size of a region.
00067     @ingroup    datatypes
00068     @see        t_rect
00069     @see        t_pt        */
00070 typedef struct _size
00071 {
00072     double width;           ///< The width
00073     double height;          ///< The height
00074 } t_size;
00075 
00076 
00077 /** A color composed of red, green, and blue components.
00078     Typically such a color is assumed to be completely opaque (with no transparency).
00079     @ingroup    color
00080     @see        t_jrgba     */
00081 typedef struct _jrgb {
00082     double red;             ///< Red component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00083     double green;           ///< Green component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00084     double blue;            ///< Blue component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00085 } t_jrgb;
00086 
00087 
00088 /** A color composed of red, green, blue, and alpha components.
00089     @ingroup color          */
00090 typedef struct _jrgba {
00091     double red;             ///< Red component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00092     double green;           ///< Green component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00093     double blue;    
00094     double alpha;           ///< Alpha (transparency) component in the range [0.0, 1.0]
00095 } t_jrgba;

00098 /** 
00099     The t_jboxdrawparams structure. This struct is provided for debugging convenience, 
00100     but should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice. 
00101 
00102     @ingroup jbox
00103 */
00104 typedef struct _jboxdrawparams {
00105     float       d_inletheight; 
00106     float       d_inletvoffset;
00107     float       d_outletheight;
00108     float       d_outletvoffset; 
00109     float       d_reserved1;            // was d_inletinset.  unused and can chop but will require rebuild all so for now I'm renaming
00110     float       d_cornersize;           // how rounded is the box
00111     float       d_borderthickness;  
00112     t_jrgba     d_bordercolor; 
00113     t_jrgba     d_boxfillcolor;
00114 } t_jboxdrawparams;

00120 /** The t_jbox struct provides the header for a Max user-interface object. 
00121     This struct should be considered opaque and is subject to change without notice.
00122     Do not access it's members directly any code.
00123     
00124     @ingroup patcher
00125 */
00126 typedef struct _jbox
00127 {
00128     t_object    b_ob;
00129     void        *obex;
00130     t_object    *b_patcher;
00131     t_rect      b_patching_rect;
00132     t_rect      b_presentation_rect;
00133     t_symbol    *b_name;
00134     t_symbol    *b_id;          // immutable box ID
00135     t_object    *b_firstin;     // the object, could be the box
00136     t_object    *b_textfield;   // optional text field. 
00137     t_symbol    *b_fontname; 
00138     double      b_fontsize; 
00139     char*       b_hint; 
00140     t_jrgba     b_color; 
00141     double      b_unused;       // we can chop this or make it do something different
00142     void        *b_binbuf;      // really an atombuf  :)
00143     long        b_temp;
00144     char        b_spooled; 
00145     char        b_hidden;
00146     char        b_hilitable;
00147     char        b_background;
00148     char        b_ignoreclick;
00149     char        b_bogus;
00150     char        b_drawfirstin;
00151     char        b_outline;
00152     char        b_growy;
00153     char        b_growboth;
00154     char        b_nogrow; 
00155     char        b_drawinlast;
00156     char        b_nofloatinsp;
00157     char        b_mousedragdelta;   // hide mouse during drag, and send mousedragdelta instead of mousedrag for infinite scrolling
00158     char        b_presentation;
00159     char        b_drawiolocked;
00160     char        b_dragactive; 
00161     char        b_drawbackground;       
00162     char        b_hinttrack;
00163     char        b_fontface;
00164     char        *b_annotation;
00165     char        b_opaque;
00166     char        b_useimagebuffer; 
00167     char        b_noinspectfirstin; 
00168     char        b_editactive;           // editing via inspector 
00169     t_symbol    *b_prototypename;
00170     void        *b_preserved7;
00171     void        *b_preserved8;
00172 } t_jbox;
00173 
00174 
00175 // selection information -- private
00176 typedef struct _pvselinfo
00177 {
00178     long nboxselect;
00179     long nlineselect;
00180     long nselboxhidden;     // how many of the selected boxes are hidden
00181     long nsellinehidden;    // how many of the selected lines are hidden
00182     long ncanignoreclick;       // how many of the selected items could accept the ingore click command
00183     long ncanrespondtoclick;// how many of the selected items could accept the respond to click command
00184     long nbg;               // how many of the selected items are in the background
00185     long nboxcolorable;     // how many respond to the color message
00186     long colorindex;        // index if one object is selected
00187     long nselboxbg;         // how many of the selected boxes are in the background
00188     long nboxinfo;          // how many of the selected boxes respond to the info message
00189     long nboxfixwidth;      // how many of the selected boxes respond to the fixwidth message
00190     long nboxpatcher;       // how many of the selected boxes are patchers
00191     long nboxpresent;       // how many of the selected boxes are in the presentation
00192     long nwiretaplines;     // how many of the selected lines have wiretaps (breakpoint + monitor)
00193     long nenabledwiretaplines;  // how many of the selected lines are enabled
00194     long sameclass;     // are all selected items of the same class (true for one object, N patchlines, or N boxes of the same class)
00195     long editbox;           // is a text box currently being edited
00196 } t_pvselinfo;

00201 /** Gets the value of a #t_rect attribute, given its parent object and name. 
00202     Do not use this on a jbox object -- use jbox_get_rect_for_view() instead!
00203 
00204     @ingroup attr
00205     @param  o       The attribute's parent object
00206     @param  name    The attribute's name
00207     @param  rect    The address of a valid #t_rect whose values will be filled-in from the attribute.
00208     
00209     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
00210                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.   */
00211 t_max_err object_attr_get_rect(t_object *o, t_symbol *name, t_rect *rect);
00212 
00213 /** Sets the value of a #t_rect attribute, given its parent object and name. 
00214     Do not use this on a jbox object -- use jbox_get_rect_for_view() instead!
00215 
00216     @ingroup attr
00217     @param  o       The attribute's parent object
00218     @param  name    The attribute's name
00219     @param  rect    The address of a valid #t_rect whose values will be used to set the attribute.
00220     
00221     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
00222                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.   */
00223 t_max_err object_attr_set_rect(t_object *o, t_symbol *name, t_rect *rect);

00273 
00274     @ingroup attr
00275     @param  b           The attribute's parent object

00279     @return             This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
00280                         or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.   */
00281 t_max_err object_attr_getcolor(t_object *b, t_symbol *attrname, t_jrgba *prgba);
00282 
00283 /** Sets the value of a #t_jrgba attribute, given its parent object and name. 
00284 
00285     @ingroup attr

00287     @param  attrname    The attribute's name
00288     @param  prgba       The address of a valid #t_jrgba whose values will be used to set the attribute.
00289

00293 
00294 
00295 /** Get the value of a #t_jrgba struct, returned as an array of atoms with the values for each component.
00296 
00297     @ingroup color
00298     @param  jrgba   The color struct whose color will be retrieved.
00299     @param  argc    The address of a variable that will be set with the number of atoms in the argv array.  
00300                     The returned value should be 4.  
00301                     The value of the int should be set to 0 prior to calling this function.
00302     @param  argv    The address of a #t_atom pointer that will receive the a new array of atoms set to the values of the jrgba struct.
00303                     The pointer should be set to NULL prior to calling this function.
00304                     There should be 4 atoms returned, representing alpha, red, green, and blue components.
00305                     When you are done using the atoms, you are responsible for freeing the pointer using sysmem_freeptr().
00306     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
00307                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.   */
00308 t_max_err jrgba_attr_get(t_jrgba *jrgba, long *argc, t_atom **argv);
00309 
00310 /** Set the value of a #t_jrgba struct, given an array of atoms with the values to use.
00311 
00312     @ingroup color
00313     @param  jrgba   The color struct whose color will be set.
00314     @param  argc    The number of atoms in the array.  This must be 4.
00315     @param  argv    The address of the first of the atoms in the array.  
00316                     There must be 4 atoms, representing alpha, red, green, and blue components.
00317     
00318     @return         This function returns the error code #MAX_ERR_NONE if successful, 
00319                     or one of the other error codes defined in #e_max_errorcodes if unsuccessful.   */
00320 t_max_err jrgba_attr_set(t_jrgba *jrgba, long argc, t_atom *argv);

00379 /** Determine of a #t_object* is a patcher object.
00380     @ingroup    jpatcher
00381     @param  p   The object pointer to test.
00382     @return     Returns true if the object is a patcher, otherwise returns non-zero.    */
00383 int jpatcher_is_patcher(t_object *p);
00384 
00385 /** If a patcher is inside a box, return its box.
00386     @ingroup    jpatcher
00387     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00388     @return     A pointer to the box containing the patcher, otherwise NULL.    */
00389 t_object* jpatcher_get_box(t_object *p);

00398 /** Determine whether a patcher is currently in a locked state.
00399     @ingroup    jpatcher
00400     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00401     @return     True if the patcher is locked, otherwise false. */
00402 char jpatcher_get_locked(t_object *p); 
00403 
00404 /** Lock or unlock a patcher.
00405     @ingroup    jpatcher
00406     @param  p   The patcher whose locked state will be changed.
00407     @param  c   Pass true to lock a patcher, otherwise pass false.
00408     @return     A Max error code.   */
00409 t_max_err jpatcher_set_locked(t_object *p, char c);

00416 char jpatcher_get_presentation(t_object *p);

00426 /** Get the first box in a patcher.
00427     All boxes in a patcher are maintained internally in a #t_linklist.
00428     Use this function together with jbox_get_nextobject() to traverse a patcher.    
00429     @ingroup    jpatcher
00430     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00431     @return     The first box in a patcher.
00432     @see        jbox_get_prevobject()
00433                 jbox_get_nextobject()
00434                 jpatcher_get_lastobject()           */
00435 t_object* jpatcher_get_firstobject(t_object *p);
00436 
00437 /** Get the last box in a patcher.
00438     All boxes in a patcher are maintained internally in a #t_linklist.
00439     Use this function together with jbox_get_prevobject() to traverse a patcher.    
00440     @ingroup    jpatcher
00441     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00442     @return     The last box in a patcher.
00443     @see        jbox_get_prevobject()
00444                 jbox_get_nextobject()
00445                 jpatcher_get_firstobject()          */
00446 t_object* jpatcher_get_lastobject(t_object *p);
00447 
00448 
00449 /** Get the first line (patch-cord) in a patcher.
00450     All lines in a patcher are maintained internally in a #t_linklist.
00451     Use this function to begin traversing a patcher's lines.    
00452     @ingroup    jpatcher
00453     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00454     @return     The first jpatchline in a patcher.  */
00455 t_object* jpatcher_get_firstline(t_object *p);
00456 
00457 /** Get the first view (jpatcherview) for a given patcher.

00459     Use this function to begin traversing a patcher's views.    
00460     @ingroup    jpatcher
00461     @param  p   The patcher to be queried.
00462     @return     The first view of a patcher.        */
00463 t_object* jpatcher_get_firstview(t_object *p);

00547 /** Set whether a patcher's foreground layer is hidden.

00549     @param  p   The patcher whose dirty bit will be set.
00550     @param  c   Pass true to hide the patcher's foreground layer, otherwise pass false.

00727 /** Find the rect for a box in a given patcherview.
00728     @ingroup            jbox
00729     @param  box         The box whose rect will be fetched.
00730     @param  patcherview A patcherview in which the box exists.
00731     @param  rect        The address of a valid #t_rect whose members will be filled in by this function.
00732     @return             A Max error code.       */
00733 t_max_err jbox_get_rect_for_view(t_object *box, t_object *patcherview, t_rect *rect);
00734 
00735 /** Change the rect for a box in a given patcherview.
00736     @ingroup            jbox
00737     @param  box         The box whose rect will be changed.
00738     @param  patcherview A patcherview in which the box exists.
00739     @param  rect        The address of a valid #t_rect that will replace the current values used by the box in the given view.
00740     @return             A Max error code.       */
00741 t_max_err jbox_set_rect_for_view(t_object *box, t_object *patcherview, t_rect *rect);
00742 
00743 /** Find the rect for a box with a given attribute name.
00744     @ingroup            jbox
00745     @param  box         The box whose rect will be fetched.
00746     @param  which       The name of the rect attribute to be fetched, for example <tt>_sym_presentation_rect</tt> or <tt>_sym_patching_rect</tt>.
00747     @param  pr          The address of a valid #t_rect whose members will be filled in by this function.
00748     @return             A Max error code.       */
00749 t_max_err jbox_get_rect_for_sym(t_object *box, t_symbol *which, t_rect *pr);
00750 
00751 /** Change the rect for a box with a given attribute name.
00752     @ingroup            jbox
00753     @param  box         The box whose rect will be changed.
00754     @param  which       The name of the rect attribute to be changed, for example <tt>_sym_presentation_rect</tt> or <tt>_sym_patching_rect</tt>.
00755     @param  pr          The address of a valid #t_rect that will replace the current values used by the box.
00756     @return             A Max error code.       */
00757 t_max_err jbox_set_rect_for_sym(t_object *box, t_symbol *which, t_rect *pr);

01082     @param  c   Pass zero to hide the outline, or non-zero to indicate that the box should draw the outline.

01591 
01592 
01593 
01594 // jbox flags
01595 // flags passed to box_new
01596 
01597 // The following flags affect how the boxes are drawn 
01598 #define JBOX_DRAWFIRSTIN        (1<<0)          ///< draw first inlet                                               @ingroup jbox
01599 #define JBOX_NODRAWBOX          (1<<1)          ///< don't draw the frame                                           @ingroup jbox
01600 #define JBOX_DRAWINLAST         (1<<2)          ///< draw inlets after update method                                @ingroup jbox
01601 #define JBOX_TRANSPARENT        (1<<3)          ///< don't make transparent unless you need it (for efficiency)     @ingroup jbox
01602 
01603 // Box growing: nogrow is clear -- box is not sizable. 
01604 // Default (none of following three flags) means box width is only sizable.
01605 // JBOX_GROWY means that X and Y are sizable and the aspect ratio is fixed (or maybe it has to be square, like dial?).  
01606 // JBOX_GROWBOTH means that X and Y are independently sizable.  
01607 #define JBOX_NOGROW             (1<<4)          ///< don't even draw grow thingie               @ingroup jbox
01608 #define JBOX_GROWY              (1<<5)          ///< can grow in y direction by dragging        @ingroup jbox
01609 #define JBOX_GROWBOTH           (1<<6)          ///< can grow independently in both x and y     @ingroup jbox
01610 
01611 // Box interaction
01612 #define JBOX_IGNORELOCKCLICK    (1<<7)          ///< box should ignore a click if patcher is locked     @ingroup jbox
01613 #define JBOX_HILITE             (1<<8)          ///< object can be hilited (focus) by clicking on it    @ingroup jbox
01614 #define JBOX_BACKGROUND         (1<<9)          ///< immediately set box into the background            @ingroup jbox
01615 #define JBOX_NOFLOATINSPECTOR   (1<<10)         ///< no floating inspector window                       @ingroup jbox
01616 
01617 // textfield: give this flag for automatic textfield support
01618 #define JBOX_TEXTFIELD          (1<<11)         ///< save/load text from textfield, unless JBOX_BINBUF flag is set              @ingroup jbox
01619 #define JBOX_FIXWIDTH           (1<<19)         ///< give the box a textfield based fix-width (bfixwidth) method                @ingroup jbox
01620 #define JBOX_FONTATTR           (1<<18)         ///< if you want font related attribute you must add this to jbox_initclass()   @ingroup jbox
01621 #define JBOX_BINBUF             (1<<14)         ///< save/load text from b_binbuf                                               @ingroup jbox
01622 
01623 #define JBOX_MOUSEDRAGDELTA     (1<<12)         ///< hides mouse cursor in drag and sends mousedragdelta instead of mousedrag (for infinite scrolling like number)  @ingroup jbox
01624 
01625 #define JBOX_COLOR              (1<<13)         ///< support the "color" method for color customization                                             @ingroup jbox
01626 #define JBOX_DRAWIOLOCKED       (1<<15)         ///< draw inlets and outlets when locked (default is not to draw them)                              @ingroup jbox
01627 #define JBOX_DRAWBACKGROUND     (1<<16)         ///< set to have box bg filled in for you based on getdrawparams method or brgba attribute          @ingroup jbox
01628 #define JBOX_NOINSPECTFIRSTIN   (1<<17)         ///< flag for objects such as bpatcher that have a different b_firstin,
01629                                                 ///< but the attrs of the b_firstin should not be shown in the inspector                            @ingroup jbox
01630 #define JBOX_DEFAULTNAMES       (1<<18)         ///< flag instructing jbox_new to attach object to the defaults object for live defaults updating   @ingroup jbox
01631 
01632 /** actual numerical values of the b_fontface attribute; use jbox_fontface() to weight 
01633     @ingroup    jbox        */
01634 enum {
01635     JBOX_FONTFACE_REGULAR = 0,      ///< normal
01636     JBOX_FONTFACE_BOLD = 1,         ///< bold
01637     JBOX_FONTFACE_ITALIC = 2,       ///< italic
01638     JBOX_FONTFACE_BOLDITALIC = 3    ///< bold and italic
01639 };
01640 
01641 // The following two are not needed in the new world. 
01642 // #define JBOX_MOVING              8           // object invalidates outside its defined clipping region       
01643 // #define JBOX_SAVVY               2048        // calls box_enddraw after box_nodraw returns false
01644 
01645 /** enumerations used for box decorators 
01646     @ingroup    jbox    */
01647 typedef enum _HitTestResult {
01648     HitNothing = 0,     ///< a hole in the box
01649     HitBox = 1,         ///< the body of the box
01650     HitInlet = 2,       ///< an inlet
01651     HitOutlet = 3,      ///< an outlet
01652     HitGrowBox = 4,     ///< the grow handle
01653     HitLine = 5         ///< a line
01654 } HitTestResult;
01655 
01656 // private
01657 typedef enum _DecoratorPaintFlags {
01658     BoxSelected = 1 << 0,
01659     DrawFirstIn = 1 << 1,
01660     NoGrow = 1 << 2,
01661     Outline = 1 << 3, 
01662     Locked = 1 << 4,
01663     InletHighlighted = 1 << 5,          // value tells index of highlighted inlet
01664     OutletHighlighted = 1 << 6          // value tells index of highlighted outlet  (only one can be highlighted)
01665 } DecoratorPaintFlags;

01671 // private
01672 void jbox_initclass(t_class *c, long flags);  
01673 
01674 /** Set up your UI object's #t_jbox member.
01675     This should be called from your UI object's free method.
01676     @ingroup        jbox
01677     @param  b       The address of your UI object's #t_jbox member (which should be the first member of the object's struct).
01678     @param  flags   Flags to set the box's behavior, such as #JBOX_NODRAWBOX.
01679     @param  argc    The count of atoms in the argv parameter.
01680     @param  argv    The address of the first in an array of atoms to be passed to the box constructor.
01681                     Typically these are simply the argument passed to your object when it is created.
01682     @return         A Max error code.       */
01683 t_max_err jbox_new(t_jbox *b, long flags, long argc, t_atom *argv);
01684 
01685 /** Tear down your UI object's #t_jbox member.
01686     This should be called from your UI object's free method.
01687     @ingroup        jbox
01688     @param  b       The address of your object's #t_jbox member (which should be the first member of the object's struct).  */
01689 void jbox_free(t_jbox *b);
01690 
01691 /** Mark the box ready to be accessed and drawn by Max.
01692     This should typically be called at the end of your UI object's new method.
01693     @ingroup        jbox
01694     @param  b       The address of your object's #t_jbox member.        */
01695 void jbox_ready(t_jbox *b);
01696 
01697

01699     @ingroup        jbox

01709 /** Send a notification to a box.  This is the same as calling object_notify() for a box.
01710     @ingroup        jbox
01711     @param  b       The address of your object's #t_jbox member.
01712     @param  s       The name of the send object.
01713     @param  msg     The notification name.
01714     @param  sender  The sending object's address.
01715     @param  data    A pointer to some data passed to the box's notify method.
01716     @return         A Max error code.
01717 */
01718 t_max_err jbox_notify(t_jbox *b, t_symbol *s, t_symbol *msg, void *sender, void *data);

01766 /** Read the specified JSON file and return a #t_dictionary object.
01767     You are responsible for freeing the dictionary with object_free(),
01768     subject to the caveats explained in @ref when_to_free_a_dictionary.
01769     @ingroup            dictionary
01770     @param  filename    The name of the file.
01771     @param  path        The path of the file.
01772     @param  d           The address of a #t_dictionary pointer that will be set to the newly created dictionary.
01773     @return             A Max error code
01774 */
01775 t_max_err dictionary_read(char *filename, short path, t_dictionary **d);
01776 
01777 /** Serialize the specified #t_dictionary object to a JSON file.

01781     @param  path        The path to which the file should be written.
01782     @return             A Max error code.
01783 */
01784 t_max_err dictionary_write(t_dictionary *d, char *filename, short path);

01800 /** Bit mask values for various meta-key presses on the keyboard.
01801     @ingroup    jmouse  */
01802 typedef enum _modifiers {
01803     eCommandKey = 1,        ///< Command Key
01804     eShiftKey = 2,          ///< Shift Key
01805     eControlKey = 4,        ///< Control Key
01806     eAltKey = 8,            ///< Alt Key
01807     eLeftButton = 16,       ///< Left mouse button
01808     eRightButton = 32,      ///< Right mouse button
01809     eMiddleButton = 64,     ///< Middle mouse button
01810     ePopupMenu = 128,       ///< Popup Menu (contextual menu requested)
01811     eCapsLock = 256         ///< Caps lock
01812 } t_modifiers;
01813 
01814 /** Return the current combination of modifier keys being held by the user.
01815     @ingroup    jmouse
01816     @return     The current modifier keys that are activated.   */
01817 t_modifiers jkeyboard_getcurrentmodifiers();

01822 t_modifiers jkeyboard_getcurrentmodifiers_realtime();

01829 /** Get the position of the mouse cursor in screen coordinates.
01830     @ingroup            jmouse
01831     @param  x           The address of a variable to hold the x-coordinate upon return.
01832     @param  y           The address of a variable to hold the y-coordinate upon return. */
01833 void jmouse_getposition_global(int *x, int *y);
01834 
01835 /** Set the position of the mouse cursor in screen coordinates.
01836     @ingroup            jmouse
01837     @param  x           The new x-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.
01838     @param  y           The new y-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.  */
01839 void jmouse_setposition_global(int x, int y);
01840 
01841 /** Set the position of the mouse cursor relative to the patcher canvas coordinates.
01842     @ingroup            jmouse
01843     @param  patcherview The patcherview upon which the mouse coordinates are based.
01844     @param  cx          The new x-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.
01845     @param  cy          The new y-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.  */
01846 void jmouse_setposition_view(t_object *patcherview, double cx, double cy);
01847 
01848 /** Set the position of the mouse cursor relative to a box within the patcher canvas coordinates.
01849     @ingroup            jmouse
01850     @param  patcherview The patcherview containing the box upon which the mouse coordinates are based.
01851     @param  box         The box upon which the mouse coordinates are based.
01852     @param  bx          The new x-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.
01853     @param  by          The new y-coordinate of the mouse cursor position.  */
01854 void jmouse_setposition_box(t_object *patcherview, t_object *box, double bx, double by);

01857 /** Mouse cursor types.
01858     @ingroup jmouse         */
01859 typedef enum _jmouse_cursortype {
01860     JMOUSE_CURSOR_NONE,                         ///< None
01861     JMOUSE_CURSOR_ARROW,                        ///< Arrow
01862     JMOUSE_CURSOR_WAIT,                         ///< Wait
01863     JMOUSE_CURSOR_IBEAM,                        ///< I-Beam
01864     JMOUSE_CURSOR_CROSSHAIR,                    ///< Crosshair
01865     JMOUSE_CURSOR_COPYING,                      ///< Copying
01866     JMOUSE_CURSOR_POINTINGHAND,                 ///< Pointing Hand
01867     JMOUSE_CURSOR_DRAGGINGHAND,                 ///< Dragging Hand
01868     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_LEFTRIGHT,             ///< Left-Right
01869     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_UPDOWN,                ///< Up-Down
01870     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_FOURWAY,               ///< Four Way
01871     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_TOPEDGE,               ///< Top Edge
01872     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_BOTTOMEDGE,            ///< Bottom Edge
01873     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_LEFTEDGE,              ///< Left Edge
01874     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_RIGHTEDGE,             ///< Right Edge
01875     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_TOPLEFTCORNER,         ///< Top-Left Corner
01876     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_TOPRIGHTCORNER,        ///< Top-Right Corner
01877     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_BOTTOMLEFTCORNER,      ///< Bottom-Left Corner
01878     JMOUSE_CURSOR_RESIZE_BOTTOMRIGHTCORNER      ///< Bottom-Right Corner
01879 } t_jmouse_cursortype;

01932 void jmonitor_getdisplayrect_foralldisplays(long workarea, t_rect *rect);           // get union of all display rects
